subject: Re: [junit] assert failure without exiting test.
msgSnippet: ... Two comments: 1) We should remain civil... telling someone to then leave the group just doesn t seem appropriate, though I don t mean to impune anyone s
messageBody:
On Tue, 2004-03-30 at 06:13, Raja Nagendra Kumar wrote:
> Sorry I did not mean to hurt the group..I wanted to say that none of
> them has responded to this question of mine..One reason could be I have
> not put up my requirements clearly..
>
> J.B I would be more happy if you could you reply to my suggested solution..
>
> Regards,
> Nagendra
>
>
> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
> > Raja Nagendra Kumar wrote:
> >
> > > I had a similar requirement and could not get any help from the group.
> >
> > Then leave the group.

Two comments:

1) We should remain civil... telling someone to "then leave the group"
just doesn't seem appropriate, though I don't mean to impune anyone's
professionalism. ;)

2) Raja, J.B. is a paid professional. If you desire to have his
personal input it would behoove you to offer him payment for his
services. As I am sure you do not want to do that I respectfully
suggest that you take what you can get. This is a public forum and we
all participate on a voluntary basis. If you aren't getting an answer
that satisfies then rephrase the question (as has been suggested).

--
Jason Rogers

"Where there is no vision, the people perish..."
Bible, Proverbs 29:18
